alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 6:03PM MST until June 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Antelope Canyon in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST /900 PM MDT/. * At 601 PM MST /701 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Antelope Creek basin. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Antelope Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Antelope Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Antelope Creek Basin, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Upper Antelope Canyon, Lower Antelope Canyon, Owl Canyon, Rattlesnake Canyon, Ramshead Canyon, Wind Pebble Canyon and Porcupine Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of Antelope Canyon and other area slot canyons immediately! Deadly flash flooding is imminent or occurring!
